Essential Ingredients for Cheesy Potato And Egg Casserole Gathering the right ingredients is key to making this casserole shine, and these ones come together to create a delicious, hearty meal. This section focuses on the precise measurements and items you need, ensuring your recipe turns out just right. Remember, you can substitute some elements for dietary preferences, but we‚Äôll stick to the core list first. - 1 pound (approximately 450 grams) Italian sausage, cooked - 1 yellow onion, chopped and saut√©ed in sausage grease - 7 eggs - 1/2 cup (120 milliliters) milk - 20 ounces (about 567 grams) frozen diced hash browns - 8 ounces (around 225 grams) mild cheddar cheese, grated (reserve about 1 cup/113 grams for topping) - Salt and pepper to taste These ingredients serve 10 to 12 people and can be swapped if needed, like using hamburger or ham instead of sausage. Fresh potatoes work too if you peel, dice, and parboil them until tender, which helps keep things moist without excess water. How to Prepare the Perfect Cheesy Potato And Egg Casserole: Step-by-Step Guide Let‚Äôs dive into making this casserole, a straightforward process that yields amazing results every time. Spray a 9√ó13-inch casserole dish with non-stick spray to keep everything from sticking. Next, cook the sausage and saut√© the chopped onion in the sausage grease for added flavor. In a large bowl, mix together the 7 eggs, 1/2 cup milk, 20 ounces frozen diced hash browns, the cooked sausage and onions, 8 ounces grated mild cheddar cheese (keeping about 1 cup for topping), salt, and pepper. Pour this mixture into your prepared casserole dish and spread it out evenly. Bake for 35 minutes, then remove from the oven, sprinkle the reserved cheese on top, and bake for an additional 8 minutes. Let the casserole rest for 15 to 20 minutes before serving to allow it to set properly. Cooking times might vary based on your potato type and moisture, so keep an eye on it for the best texture.
